name.description: Give a name to this configuration so it can be later referenced by config-ref.
name.caption: Name
name.name: name

string.description: Application name registered on Google API console.
string.caption: Application Name
string.name: applicationName

string.description: The OAuth scopes you want to request.
string.caption: Scope
string.name: scope

globalRef.description: Specify which configuration to use for this invocation.
globalRef.caption: Config Reference
globalRef.name: config-ref

cloud-connector.description: Google Calendars Cloud connector. This connector covers almost all the Google Calendar API v3 using OAuth2 for authentication.
cloud-connector.caption: GMail Connector

string.description: An instance of . If not provided, then no filtering criteria is applied.
string.caption: Search Term Reference
string.name: searchTerm-ref

enum.description: The folder in which to search. If you want all of them then use ALL_MAIL.
enum.caption: Folder
enum.name: folder

boolean.description: If true, all read messages will be deleted upon operation completion.
boolean.caption: Expunge
boolean.name: expunge

string.description: The format to be used to parse the date attributes. If no dateFormat is specified, then RFC3339 is assumed.
string.caption: Date Format
string.name: dateFormat

string.description: Used to fetch one given message by id.
string.caption: Message Id
string.name: messageId

string.description: A date in the specified string format giving an upper bound filter to the received date. If no dateFormat is specified, then RFC3339 is assumed.
string.caption: Received After
string.name: receivedAfter

string.description: A date in the specified string format giving a lower bound filter to the received date. If no dateFormat is specified, then RFC3339 is assumed.
string.caption: Received Before
string.name: receivedBefore

string.description: A date in the specified string format giving an upper bound filter to the sent date. If no dateFormat is specified, then RFC3339 is assumed.
string.caption: Sent After
string.name: sentAfter

string.description: A date in the specified string format giving a lower bound filter to the sent date. If no dateFormat is specified, then RFC3339 is assumed.
string.caption: Sent Before
string.name: sentBefore

string.description: The id of the thread for which the message should belong.
string.caption: Thread Id
string.name: threadId

integer.description: Used to look for the message with the specified number.
integer.caption: Message Number
integer.name: messageNumber

enum.description: The folder in which to search. If you want all of them then use ALL_MAIL.
enum.caption: Folder
enum.name: folder

boolean.description: If true, all read messages will be deleted upon operation completion.
boolean.caption: Expunge
boolean.name: expunge

string-list.description: A list of Strings which represent the body terms that the messages need to have. This is an OR operation logic. All messages with any one of these terms will be returned.
string-list.caption: Body Terms

string-list.description: A list of to specify flag values that the messages should have.
string-list.caption: Flags

string-list.description: A list of addresses to be found in the from attribute. This is an OR operation logic. All messages with any one of these addresses will be returned.
string-list.caption: From Addresses

string-list.description: A list of Strings which represent the header terms that the messages need to have. This is an OR operation logic. All messages with any one of these terms will be returned.
string-list.caption: Header Terms

string-list.description: A list of Strings which represent the labels that the messages need to have. This is an OR operation logic. All messages with any one of these labels will be returned.
string-list.caption: Labels

string-list.description: A list of Strings which represent terms that the message should have. This is an OR operation logic. All messages with any one of these terms will be returned.
string-list.caption: Raw Search Terms

string-list.description: A list of Strings which represent the subject terms that the messages need to have. This is an OR operation logic. All messages with any one of these terms will be returned.
string-list.caption: Subject Terms

string-list.description: A list of addresses to be found in the to attribute. This is an OR operation logic. All messages with any one of these addresses will be returned.
string-list.caption: To Addresses

string.description: The domain name to use when setting up the callback endpoint.
string.caption: Domain
string.name: domain

string.description: The local port to use when setting up the callback endpoint.
string.caption: Local Port
string.name: localPort

string.description: The remote port is the port used to build the external callback URL.
string.caption: Remote Port
string.name: remotePort

string.description: The path to use when setting up the callback endpoint.
string.caption: Path
string.name: path

nested.description: Configuration element for storage of access tokens
